de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.components
Class FileSelectionComposite

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
          org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
              org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
                  de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.components.FileSelectionComposite
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
public class FileSelectionComposite
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite

The composite for the SWTGui's main window. It offers most of its element and the corresponding methods.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-8-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

addToFileList

protected void addToFileList(java.lang.String filename,
                             java.lang.String fullFilename,
                             java.lang.Object jarFile)
Add an entry to the fileListArray.

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the new object (the name of the file only).
fullFilename - The filename including the full path to it.
jarFile - The jarFile the file is in. A null value indicates a file that just is on the file system.

resetCurrentClass

protected void resetCurrentClass()
Sets the field currentClass to null, indicating it has to be reloaded, even if the same class would be selected (otherwise reloading of a changed class will not work properly).

loadRootsIntoDirectoryTree

public void loadRootsIntoDirectoryTree()
Load the root directories of the file system into the directory tree, priorly removing any entries.

classWasSelected

protected void classWasSelected(java.lang.String[] selection)
Process the current class selection, refreshing the method list if desired.

Parameters:
selection - The selection String.

changeFileListEnabled

protected void changeFileListEnabled(boolean value)
Enable or disable the fileList. If it is disabled, also disable the file inspection and the file selection button.

Parameters:
value - A boolean which indicates whether to enable (true), or disable (false) the fileList.

changeFileInspectSelectButtonEnabled

protected void changeFileInspectSelectButtonEnabled(boolean value)
Enable or disable the the file inspection and the file selection button. If they are enabled, also enable the fileList. If they are disabled, also disable the methodList.

Parameters:
value - A boolean which indicated whether to enable (true), or disable (false) the two button.

changeMethodListEnabled

protected void changeMethodListEnabled(boolean value)
Enable or disable the methodList. If it is enabled, also enable the file inspection button. If it is disabled, also disable the options.

Parameters:
value - A boolean which indicates whether to enable (true), or disable (false) the methodList.

changeOptionsEnabled

protected void changeOptionsEnabled(boolean value)
Enable or disable the options. If they are enabled, also enable the methodList. Also invoke the checking of options dependend on the symbolic execution mode.

Parameters:
value - A boolean which indicates whether to enable (true), or disable (false) the options.

resetPredefinedDataValues

protected void resetPredefinedDataValues()
Reset the values of the predefined data.

resetPredefinedParametersValue

public void resetPredefinedParametersValue()
Update the appropriate widgets with the current number of predefined parameters, generators and array element generators.

resetVariavleValidatorsValue

public void resetVariavleValidatorsValue()
Set the number of validators to 0, since this functionality is not yet active.

resetVariableGeneratorsValue

public void resetVariableGeneratorsValue()
Set the number of generators to 0, since this functionality is not yet active.

changeCursor

protected void changeCursor(int style)
Change the cursors style.

Parameters:
style - The style as an int, according to the available SWT styles for cursors.

refreshTree

protected void refreshTree()
Refresh the directory tree.

showMethods

protected boolean showMethods(boolean refresh)
Show the methods of a class file. Render message boxes in case of exceptions, informing the user about the problem detected.

Parameters:
refresh - If set to true, the class file will be read and parsed even if it is cached.
Returns:
true, if the methods could be shown, false otherwise.

loadMethods

protected void loadMethods(java.lang.String className,
                           boolean refresh)
                    throws ClassFileException
Load the methods from a classFile. This is done in two steps: 1. Use the classLoader to get the desired class. 2. Load the methods from this class. If the methods detects that its work would lead to no change (i.e., the methods of the given class are already loaded) it will do nothing.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class to load the Methods from.
refresh - If set to true, the class file will be read and parsed even if it is cached.
Throws:
ClassFileException - Thrown on fatal errors loading or parsing a class file.

getSelectedMethod

protected Method getSelectedMethod()
Get the selected method as an instance of Method.

Returns:
The selected Method, or null in cases of no success.

expandDirectoryTree

protected void expandDirectoryTree(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem root)
Expand the directory tree from the given root on.

Parameters:
root - The TreeItem to start the expansion with.

openFileDirectly

public void openFileDirectly()
Open the file dialog for the direct opening of a file. If a file is returned, expand the directory tree accordingly.

browseTroughTheDirectoryTree

public boolean browseTroughTheDirectoryTree(java.lang.String path,
                                            org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem item)
Browse and expand the directory tree so it shows the just opened file. The method is invoked recursively until the desired node has been reached.

Parameters:
path - The path of the file.
item - The TreeItem that is currently opened.
Returns:
true, if the path could be followed, false otherwise.

getCurrentClassPath

protected void getCurrentClassPath()
Get the basic class path and replace the first class path entry with it.
